com.analog.lyric.dimple.options

Class DimpleOptionHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.options.AbstractOptionHolder
      • com.analog.lyric.options.LocalOptionHolder
        • com.analog.lyric.dimple.options.DimpleOptionHolder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDimpleEnvironmentHolder, IDimpleEventSource, IOptionHolder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DimpleEnvironment, Node, SolverEventSource

    public abstract class DimpleOptionHolder
extends LocalOptionHolder
implements IDimpleEventSource, IDimpleEnvironmentHolder
    Base class for dimple objects that can hold options and generate events.

    This extends LocalOptionHolder in the following ways:

    • It also implements the IDimpleEventSource interface, so that all Dimple objects on which you can set options are also event sources.
    • It overrides the getOptionDelegates() method
    Since:
    0.07

    • Method Detail

      • getOptionDelegates

        public EventSourceIterator getOptionDelegates()
        Iterates over option holders in the order in which options should be looked up.

        Unlike the default implementation, which simply walks up the chain of option parents, this will visit both the option parent and the corresponding model object. This is described in more detail in EventSourceIterator.

        Specified by:
        getOptionDelegates in interface IOptionHolder
        Overrides:
        getOptionDelegates in class AbstractOptionHolder

      • getOptionParent

        @Nullable
public IOptionHolder getOptionParent()
        The "parent" of this option holder to which option lookup will be delegated for option keys that are not set on this object. Used by IOptionHolder.getOption(IOptionKey).

        Implementors should ensure that chain of parents is not circular!

        By default, the option parent is the same as the event parent.

        Specified by:
        getOptionParent in interface IOptionHolder
        Overrides:
        getOptionParent in class AbstractOptionHolder
        Returns:
        the parent object or null if there is none.

      • getEnvironment

        public DimpleEnvironment getEnvironment()
        Returns environment instance used by this object.

        Returns environment for containing graph if available, otherwise DimpleEnvironment.active().

        Specified by:

      • getReplicatedNonZeroListFromOptions

        protected double[] getReplicatedNonZeroListFromOptions(IOptionKey<OptionDoubleList> listKey,
                                           IOptionKey<java.lang.Double> singleKey,
                                           int size,
                                           @Nullable
                                           double[] array)
        Returns list of not all zero doubles from option settings.

        1. Look up the option value for listKey using AbstractOptionHolder.getOption(com.analog.lyric.options.IOptionKey<T>):
          • If non-null and contains at least one non-zero value, it's values will be returned.
          • If non-null and is empty or contains all zeros, an empty array will be returned.
        2. Otherwise, look up the option value for singleKey using AbstractOptionHolder.getOptionOrDefault(com.analog.lyric.options.IOptionKey<T>):
          • If zero, an empty array will be returned.
          • If non-zero, an array of length size containing only this value will be returned.

        This can be used in situations in which there is a global parameter, such as damping, that may be given specific values for different edges of a node.

        Parameters:
        listKey - is the primary lookup key for the list.
        singleKey - is a secondary lookup key to be used if listKey not set.
        size - is the size of list to return when replicating value from singleKey.
        array - is the array into which the result should be written. This will only be used if it is non-null and of exactly the correct length.
        Since:
        0.07
